model

Interface Clause

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PCExpression
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOperator, And, Arithmetic, Equal, Not, SimpleSentence

    public interface Clause
extends PCExpression
    This interface represents a subdivision among the predicate expressions. It extends the PCExpression interface and creates the subdivision of the predicate expressions that can be a query.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractSolutionNode getSolver(RuleSet rules, SubstitutionSet parentSolution, AbstractSolutionNode parentNode)
      Creates a solver which is a node in the tree proof.

      • Methods inherited from interface model.PCExpression

        replaceVariables, standardizeVariablesApart

    • Method Detail

      • getSolver

        AbstractSolutionNode getSolver(RuleSet rules,
                             SubstitutionSet parentSolution,
                             AbstractSolutionNode parentNode)
        Creates a solver which is a node in the tree proof. This method must be implemented in every implementation of Clause.

        This function is recursive over all objects that can be proved and creates the tree of proof for a clause.

        Parameters:
        rules - the RuleSet object containing the rules of knowledge.
        parentSolution - the solution known so far at the parent node.
        Returns:
        the node of the tree of proof.
        See Also:
        AbstractSolutionNode.nextSolution()
